snippet: The federal appellate decision overturned the conviction of a sales representative who said a ban on promotion of unapproved uses violated his freedom of speech.
abstract: Federal appeals court, in case that could have broad ramifications for the pharmaceutical industry, throws out conviction of sales representative Alfred Caronia, who sold anti-narcolepsy drug Xyrem for uses not approved by the Food and Drug Administration; court says ban on so-called off-label marketing violates representative's freedom of speech.
lead_paragraph: The federal appellate decision overturned the conviction of a sales representative who said a ban on promotion of unapproved uses violated his freedom of speech.

headline.seo: Ruling in Off-Label Marketing Case Is a Win for Drug Makers
headline.main: Ruling Is Victory for Drug Companies in Promoting Medicine for Other Uses
headline.print_headline: Ruling Is Victory for Drug Companies In Promoting Medicine for Other Uses
